column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////This is the best deep dish I've ever had. Given I'm a straight up tourist and have only had one or 2 slices of Chicago Deep Dish in Chicago
column2: the crust was buttery and crispy but not dry near the sauce. The tomatoes were fresh and and sausage was delicious. It was super filling and I was barely able to eat half of a personal size one. Somehow after I brought 2 larger ones home I was able to eat more than half of that after baking it at home. The frozen pizzas survived a couple hours to the airport and a 4 hour plane ride
column3: and the hour long drive home. I popped that baby right in the oven as soon as I put my stuff down...and even the frozen version was amazing
